tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE call_detail_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    caller_number VARCHAR(10),
    callee_number VARCHAR(10),
    call_duration INT,
    call_date TIMESTAMP,
    call_quality_rating INT
)

CREATE TABLE call_detail_records (
  call_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  caller_number TEXT,
  receiver_number TEXT,
  call_duration INT,
  call_quality INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_performance (
  network_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  network_name TEXT,
  latency INT,
  bandwidth INT,
  jitter INT
);

CREATE TABLE CallDetailRecords ( 
  call_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  caller_number INT, 
  receiver_number INT, 
  call_duration INT, 
  call_quality_rating FLOAT 
);

CREATE TABLE CallQualityAnalysis ( 
  analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  call_id INT, 
  network_id INT, 
  analysis_result TEXT, 
  analysis_date DATE 
);

CREATE TABLE call_records (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    caller_number VARCHAR(10),
    receiver_number VARCHAR(10),
    call_duration INT,
    call_quality_rating INT
);

CREATE TABLE network_performance (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    call_id INT,
    latency_ms INT,
    packet_loss_rate FLOAT,
    jitter_ms INT
);

CREATE TABLE call_locations (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    call_id INT,
    caller_location VARCHAR(50),
    receiver_location VARCHAR(50),
    call_duration INT
);

CREATE TABLE call_records (
    call_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    caller_number VARCHAR(10),
    receiver_number VARCHAR(10),
    call_duration INT,
    call_datetime TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE network_performance (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    call_id INT REFERENCES call_records(call_id),
    signal_strength INT,
    data_usage INT,
    call_quality VARCHAR(20)
);
